update.description:
* Update the factory so it can also be used to create new component storages. This is needed when populating the ECM from a serialized state, at which point we can't call templated functions.

* The factory and components no longer stores type names. The registered type names were being cleaned up during tests, but not the type IDs. @caguero and I debugged a bit with no success, so the current workaround is to remove names completely, since they're not being used anyway. :warning: We may just be pushing the issue down the road, it would be nice to eventually understand why the names were being reset.

---

This is needed by pull request #184
update.title: [A-4] Storage factory

content.raw: I noticed that this is being printed for a lot of tests, and also while using `ign-gazebo`, which is a red flag. We shouldn't be trying to register the same component twice.
content.html: I noticed that this is being printed for a lot of tests, and also while using ign-gazebo, which is a red flag. We shouldn't be trying to register the same component twice.

content.raw:
The error in this case is that we expect the type not to be registered yet, but it is registered from the first test:

~~~
/home/developer/ign-gazebo/src/ComponentFactory_TEST.cc:46: Failure
Value of: MyCustom::typeId
  Actual: 6167111157173746926
Expected: 0u
Which is: 0
~~~

So I think this specific failure is expected. If I remember correctly, the homebrew failures on Jenkins were segfaults, not failed expectations though.
content.html:
The error in this case is that we expect the type not to be registered yet, but it is registered from the first test:

/home/developer/ign-gazebo/src/ComponentFactory_TEST.cc:46: Failure
Value of: MyCustom::typeId
  Actual: 6167111157173746926
Expected: 0u
Which is: 0

So I think this specific failure is expected. If I remember correctly, the homebrew failures on Jenkins were segfaults, not failed expectations though.

content.raw: This used to compare `TypeIds().size()` vs `TypeNames().size()`. I don't think we need it anymore.
content.html: This used to compare TypeIds().size() vs TypeNames().size(). I don't think we need it anymore.

content.raw: That's helpful, I was just reading [something](https://blog.knatten.org/2010/04/30/be-careful-with-static-variables/) about GTest + static vars that mentioned `gtest_repeat`. I'll play with it locally too.
content.html: That's helpful, I was just reading something about GTest + static vars that mentioned gtest_repeat. I'll play with it locally too.

content.raw: I'm not up to date with this PR, but running `bin/UNIT_ComponentFactory_TEST  --gtest_repeat=2` is failing locally. Not sure if that's helpful.
content.html: I'm not up to date with this PR, but running bin/UNIT_ComponentFactory_TEST --gtest_repeat=2 is failing locally. Not sure if that's helpful.

content.raw:
I'm pushing a couple more checks just to be safe, but they will most likely not solve the issue.

Another thing to consider is that GTest may be doing something funky in between `TEST_F`s which is messing up the static variables from the second `TEST_F` onwards. We would still need to work around it, but it would mean that our code doesn't really have any problems, because things work during normal use.

The quickest workaround would be to disable the problematic tests on homebrew, the 2nd quickest would be to split tests into several files so that there's one `TEST_F` per file.

I still want to see a new homebrew failure report to check all the assumptions above before anything though - the old builds are gone and the current builds are broken because the ign-physics commit is outdated.
content.html:
I'm pushing a couple more checks just to be safe, but they will most likely not solve the issue.

Another thing to consider is that GTest may be doing something funky in between TEST_Fs which is messing up the static variables from the second TEST_F onwards. We would still need to work around it, but it would mean that our code doesn't really have any problems, because things work during normal use.

The quickest workaround would be to disable the problematic tests on homebrew, the 2nd quickest would be to split tests into several files so that there's one TEST_F per file.

I still want to see a new homebrew failure report to check all the assumptions above before anything though - the old builds are gone and the current builds are broken because the ign-physics commit is outdated.
